common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues in Remote Environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting Pieces OS to IDE extensions (VSCode, JetBrains) within remote environments like WSL2 and Docker.  This seems related to network configurations and Pieces OS's security features.  Proposed solutions involve custom URL settings, DNS configurations, and potential server-side modifications.  Pieces team is actively investigating and providing workarounds.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Network issues within WSL2 might be the root cause.
* Systemd option and dns-tunnel could potentially resolve the problem.
* Pieces VSCode extension can connect to Pieces OS but cannot render Copilot.
* Snap installation might be related to the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Network connectivity problems within WSL2.
* Copilot rendering failure despite successful connection to Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Enabling the Systemd option in WSL2.
* Utilizing the dns-tunnel functionality.
* Investigating the possibility of snap installation influence.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* Further investigation and updates are expected.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of considering network issues within WSL2 as a potential cause for connectivity problems.
* The involvement of the snap installation warrants further exploration.
* The successful connection to Pieces OS but the inability to render Copilot suggest a potential issue with the Copilot rendering mechanism within the VSCode extension.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points Raised:** * User `malanciault` encounters an error connecting to Pieces OS in VS Code Dev Container. * The error persists regardless of project state and custom URL設定. * User attempts to connect through `http://192.168.0.129:39300` and `host.docker.internal:39300`. **Problems Identified:** * New Pieces OS security feature limits server listening to loopback interface. * Docker mounts and custom URL integration conflict with Webview tool windows. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Modify server to listen on all interfaces (patch under testing). * Set custom URL to `http://pieceshost:39300` with DNS entries `pieceshost → host.docker.internal → localhost`. **Current Status/Outcome:** * Workaround offered but awaiting official patch. * VS Code extension version 2.0.1 released and tested, but user `malanciault` experiences continued issues. * Patch released in Pieces for VSCode extension version 2.0.2, resolving the issue. **Additional Notes:** * Problem likely triggered by Pieces OS version 11.0.0 changes. * User `malanciault` scheduled a video call with Pieces support for further troubleshooting.

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Problems Identified:**

* Logs were needed to diagnose the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A development build of Pieces OS was created to potentially resolve the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The outcome of the proposed solution is pending.

**Additional Notes:**

* The development build should be uninstalled after testing to allow for proper updates.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Unresponsive or Returning Errors
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot becoming unresponsive or returning errors like "I'm sorry. Something went wrong..."  Issues are often linked to specific Pieces OS versions, large files, or problems with OpenAI API keys. Solutions include updating Pieces OS, removing OpenAI keys, or switching to a different LLM model like GPT4o.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @bschwenk encounters context issues when using a specific file with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o.
* The system returns a response but indicates the file is not included in the context.
* Additionally, an issue with line numbers wrapping is observed.

**Problems Identified:**

* Two issues: 1) context issue with specific file, 2) line numbers wrapping.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces investigates the context issue and proposes a fix.
* @sam-at-pieces confirms the fix and includes it in the next release.
* @mark-at-pieces confirms the context issue is resolved for tomorrow's release (11.0.4).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The context issue with the specific file is resolved and will be released in version 11.0.4.
* The status of the line numbers wrapping issue is unclear.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user expresses appreciation for the team's help.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users were experiencing issues with Claude and Gemini models.
* These issues were likely caused by invalid OpenAI API keys or model-specific problems.
* Solutions included removing OpenAI API keys or switching to the GPT4o model.

**Problems Identified:**

* Claude and Gemini models were malfunctioning.
* OpenAI API keys were becoming invalid over time.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Users were advised to remove their OpenAI API keys.
* Users were advised to switch to the GPT4o model.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for users who have removed their OpenAI API keys or switched to the GPT4o model.
* The underlying cause of the issues with Claude and Gemini models is still being investigated.
* Users are advised to keep their Pieces application updated to version 11.0.3 and to be signed in to Pieces to ensure a higher rate limit. 

**Additional Information:**

* It is recommended to keep OpenAI API keys out of the Pieces product for the time being.
* The developer is investigating why OpenAI API keys may be causing failures.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Launch and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop App failing to launch, remaining stuck on connecting, or displaying a non-dismissable overlay.  This occurs across Windows versions and Pieces OS versions. Proposed solutions include checking for updates, reinstalling the app, and contacting support with log files from Documents > com.pieces.os.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

- **Issue:** ThemePark is experiencing issues launching the Windows Desktop Version of Pieces after the latest Pieces OS 11.0 update.
- **Status:** The issue has been acknowledged by the Pieces Support bot and assigned to a team member for investigation.
- **Key Points:**
   - The issue seems to be related to the latest Pieces OS 11.0 update.
   - Other users have reported similar issues with Pieces Core Services and the Pieces for Desktop App.
- **Problems Identified:**
   - Pieces for Desktop App is not launching after the OS update.
   - The user is unable to utilize the desktop functionalities of Pieces.
- **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
   - The user has been provided with links to relevant resources and similar issues.
   - The Pieces team is investigating the issue further.
- **Current Status/Outcome:**
   - No permanent solution has been implemented yet. The Pieces team is currently investigating the issue.

## Next Steps:

- The user should provide their Windows version and confirm the installation of both PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop.
- The Pieces team will continue investigating the issue and provide updates within the issue conversation.

related_issues.title: Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
related_issues.text:
Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

version: 8.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Issue:**
I am encountering difficulties with installing and launching the Pieces Windows desktop version. After a successful installation, the software fails to open properly. Despite confirming its presence in the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Download and install the Pieces Windows desktop version.
- Attempt to launch the software.
- Observe that the program does not open on the screen.
- Check the task manager to confirm the software is running in the background.

**Expected Behavior:**
Upon installation, the Pieces Windows desktop version should launch and display its interface on the screen, allowing users to interact with it

**Actual Behavior:**
After installation, the software does not open as expected. Despite running in the background according to the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**System Information:**

- Windows version: 22H2 (OS Build 19045)

**Additional Notes:**
I have attempted to troubleshoot this issue without success. Any assistance or insights into resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Pieces OS Launch Failure

**Key points raised:**

* Multiple users reported an issue where Pieces OS fails to launch when initiated from the Pieces suite or Start Menu.
* The issue appears to be specific to Pieces OS, as other Pieces applications function normally.
* Users have confirmed being on the latest versions of all relevant software.
* The issue persists despite multiple attempts to resolve it.

**Problems identified:**

* The underlying cause of the launch failure is unclear.
* The issue affects users on both Windows and macOS.
* The problem hinders the ability to utilize Pieces OS effectively.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Users were requested to share log files from the application.
* Reinstalling Pieces OS was suggested as a potential solution.
* Links to previous GitHub issues with similar symptoms were provided.
* Developers investigated the issue and confirmed its existence.
* Updates on the resolution status were provided.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved as of January 16, 2025.
* Developers are actively investigating the problem.
* No further updates have been provided since November 2023.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue appears to be widespread, affecting a significant number of users.
* The lack of a clear resolution creates uncertainty and frustration among users.
* Developers are encouraged to provide regular updates on the progress of their investigation.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Bugs and Fixes
common_issues.description: Multiple bug reports describe issues with the Pieces Desktop App on macOS, including eager saving of conversation titles, repetitive welcome messages, and unresponsive Copilot. Solutions involve patches and updates in upcoming releases (PiecesOS 11.0.4, next Desktop App release). Users are advised to update to the latest versions for fixes.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage, and launch failures with PiecesOS.  Suggested solutions include restarting PiecesOS, using the "Optimize Memory" feature, and contacting support with log files for further assistance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## High Memory Usage in PiecesOS: GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Memory Usage:**
    * Users report PiecesOS consuming high amounts of RAM, up to 5GB.
    * This issue persists even when no models are running.
    * The problem appears on various platforms, including Linux and Windows.
* **Performance:**
    * Users experience CPU spikes up to 50% or more when running PiecesOS in the background.
    * This leads to slowdowns and affects overall system performance.
* **Expected Behavior:**
    * Ideally, PiecesOS would have minimal impact on RAM and CPU usage.

**Problems Identified:**

* High memory usage due to ML models, background processes, and database usage.
* CPU spikes related to PiecesOS activities, including Live Context feature.
* Concerns about the on-device ML impacting performance.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Memory Optimization:**
    * Click on the Pieces "P" icon in the global toolbar/taskbar to access the "Optimize Memory" option.
    * This unloads unused ML models and frees up RAM.
* **Performance Improvements:**
    * Ongoing efforts to optimize PiecesOS for better resource management.
    * Investigating further optimizations for features like Live Context.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing, with PiecesOS using around ~2GB of RAM as standard.
* Users are encouraged to utilize the "Optimize Memory" feature and seek further troubleshooting from the Pieces team if exceeding 2GB.
* The company is actively working on improving resource management and efficiency.

**Overall:**

While high memory and CPU usage remain a concern, Pieces is actively addressing the issue and users are encouraged to collaborate with the team to track and resolve individual cases.

recommendations: **Prioritize Connectivity Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the recurring issue of "Pieces OS Connectivity Issues in Remote Environments." This will directly impact users facing challenges with IDE extensions in WSL2 and Docker environments.

**Improve Copilot Stability:** Address the root causes behind "Pieces Copilot Unresponsive or Returning Errors." Focus on enhancing error handling, optimizing performance for large files, and providing clear guidance on OpenAI API key management.

**Enhance Desktop App Stability:** Investigate and resolve the issues related to "Pieces Desktop App Launch and Connection Issues" and "Pieces Desktop App Bugs and Fixes." This includes addressing launch failures, non-dismissable overlays, and other reported bugs on both Windows and macOS.

**Monitor PiecesOS Performance:** Continue monitoring and optimizing "PiecesOS Performance Issues," such as high RAM/CPU usage. Encourage users to utilize the "Optimize Memory" feature and provide support for persistent cases.

**Proactive Communication:**  For known issues like the Copilot and Desktop App bugs, proactively communicate the expected resolution timelines (e.g., PiecesOS 11.0.4, next Desktop App release) through release notes, in-app notifications, and support channels to keep users informed.
